lexUnit.name: glitter.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: shine with a bright, shimmering reflected light.

sentence.text: She felt alive as never before , and her eyes were glittering with excitement .
Joyce 's eyes glittered with prurient interest .
Julius 's dark brown eyes glittered brightly .
His eyes glittered fiercely .
Her eyes were glittering through her lashes .
In the dim light the gold and strong colours glittered and glowed with rich intensity .
Jealousy glittered in Okawi 's eyes .
Amusement glittering in his beautiful eyes , he added , ` Although anyone who gives away a leprechaun ca n't be all bad .
Scorn at the feeble prevarication glittered in Iris 's eyes .
Annoyance glittered darkly in his eyes .
Anger glittered coldly in his eyes .
Their wells were crammed with cone helmets and glittered with shield-hoops and the faggoted filaments that were spears .
Ahead of her glittered the tracks of Frere 's previous solitary excursion .
That removed the sight of the gold-leafed cupola that traditionally glitters above Grand Central Station .

The men are so lovely , enormous and gentle , brown as amber -- enormous black eyes and stiff bristly black hair which spurts off their foreheads like solidified jet and glitters blue in the sunshine .
` I 'm a spider , " she told the man beside her , and her smile glittered reckless like a knife .

One small colony remained all the time on their beach , an isolated solitary place of grey pebbles below greenish breakwaters ; high above them the blind-eyed office blocks glittered pink and yellow in the sun .
The trail he was on led down to another valley , running at right angles to this one and bifurcated by a tumbling mountain stream that glittered in the afternoon sun .
Glittering in the desert sun , some of the lakes have been specially reserved for tourist enjoyment , combining warm waters for bathing and , naturally , no shortage of golden sands .
One minute he was at the table and the next he was threading his way between the dancers , leaving Geoffrey asleep with his cheek resting on a bread roll , bits of tinsel glittering in his hair .
Sitting outside , difficult to see because she was a black dog , was the Dean 's labrador bitch , water from her dark coat dripping and glittering in the kitchen light .
Necklaces , pendants , bracelets , rings ; silver and turquoise glittered in the white light .
It was a bright February morning , and the mali 's newly polished buttons glittered in the sunlight .
Isobel snapped open her ornate handbag , which glittered like a chandelier .
In the daytime the view from the huge windows on the south side was smog , but when darkness hid the mass misdemeanours of the city , Los Angeles glittered like a fairy kingdom .
Her fine red hair glittered like gold in the watery sunlight .
From a wall niche , a pair of crystal decanters glittered like splinters of ice , and beneath them the object of my search , the pyx itself .
Swift and deadly , they are armoured in shining silver and armed with white lances with diamond-hard tips which glitter like stars .
Thin threads of blood glittered on his forehead and cheeks .
Pearl chokers glittered on every female neck ; huge diamonds flashed in the strobe lights .
Oily water glittered through gaps in the teak boards as we climbed the gangplank .

The gardens were particularly lovely this morning , trees and grass glittered with dew and the hibiscus and bougainvillaea were just beginning to open and show their gay pink and purple and orange colours .
Almost opposite the bridge was one of the poorest streets in town , its uneven cobblestones glittering with broken glass , its gutters clogged with litter .
The moon was full , the dark waters of the ocean glittering with silver light , and the heat was stifling .
And his eyes -- piercing , vividly blue , and glittering with a light that she was yet too young to understand , but which called to something very feminine within her .
Something glittered with a golden sheen between his lips .
The sky was clear and glittering with icy stars .

The long moist furrows of the new-turned soil glittered under the pale February sun , contrasting with the gold stubble fields and the grassy pastures where sheep clustered around their feeding troughs .

Crystal chandeliers glittered brightly above a marble floor ; a quartet of musicians played music -- real music , Nicolo thought , incongruously , not the brain-frying stuff they 'd played during the fashion show .
I turned to share the wonder of it , but she was gazing up at the bloom of flame surging from the chimney 's mouth , and beyond where the evening-star glittered against the deepening blue sky .
A diamond tie pin glittered at his throat .
All around him rode many squadrons of Rajput cavalry whose armour glittered from afar .

Everything glittered without being truly gaudy , was orderly , in its carefully chosen place , and there was little room for doubt that the madame ruled with an iron fist inside her elbow-length satin gloves .
Liz 's chandelier had glittered bravely .
Up above , the night stars glittered eternally , and nothing there presaged the doom and desolation which was about to befall Brentford .
The blue grey mud banks glittered where wet from the tide , but lay dry and cracked like acres of crazy paving above the high water mark .
The table in the corner of the terrace glittered , an unexpectedly formal island of glass and silver in the darkness .
In the morning he found a stone the size of the palm of his hand , a smooth stone that glittered and looked precious .
The gold background and coloured pictures glitter and glow in the subdued light which filters through the tiny round-headed windows and gives a sensation of unreality and fairy-like mysticism .
